{{infobox character | name=Draugluin | people=[[Werewolves|Werewolf]] | image=Angel Falto - Draugluin.jpg | caption="Draugluin" by [[:Category:Images by Angel Falto|Angel Falto]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles=''Father of the [[Werewolves]]'' | position= | location=[[Tol-in-Gaurhoth]] | affiliation=[[Sauron]], [[Morgoth]] | language= | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{FA|465}}{{GA|182}} | deathlocation=[[Tol-in-Gaurhoth]] | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children=Countless offspring, including [[Carcharoth]] | gender=Male | height= | hair=Blue | eyes= | clothing= | weapons=Fangs, claws | steed= }} '''Draugluin''' was the first [[Werewolf]]. == History == Bred from [[wolves]] and inhabited with an evil spirit imprisoned by [[Sauron]] himself, Draugluin was the sire of all Werewolves of [[Beleriand]], and dwelled with his master in [[Tol-in-Gaurhoth]], the former watchtower of [[Finrod|Finrod Felagund]], which he aided to conquer. He was slain by [[Huan]] during the [[Quest for the Silmaril]], though he informed Sauron that Huan was present. [[Beren]] and [[Lúthien]] used his pelt to sneak into [[Angband]].{{S|Beren}} Draugluin was the sire of [[Carcharoth]] and many other Werewolves. It is probable the [[Wargs]] of the [[Third Age]] were descended from him, as these wolves could speak, suggesting they had ''[[fëar]]''.{{fact}} He may have been a fallen [[Maiar|Maia]].{{fact}} == Etymology == {{Pronounce|Draugluin.mp3|Ardamir}} The name ''Draugluin'' means "Blue Wolf" in [[Sindarin]], from ''[[draug]]'' ("wolf") + ''[[luin]]'' ("blue"),{{S|Appendix}} in reference to the color of his pelt. == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| DRA |DRA='''DRAUGLUIN'''
